text: was a after Eichō and before Kōwa. This period started in November 1097 and ended in August 1099.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Jōtoku" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 434. The reigning emperor was .Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). Annales des empereurs du japon, pp. 172–176; Brown, Delmer et al. (1979). Gukanshō, pp. 317–319; Varley, H. Paul. (1980). Jinnō Shōtōki, p. 202. ==Events of the Jōtoku Era== * 1097 (Jōtoku 1, 1st month): Minamoto no Tsunenobu died at age 82.Titsingh, p. 176. * 1097 (Jōtoku 1, 4th month): The emperor visited the temple at Gion. * 1097 (Jōtoku 1, 10th month): The emperor visited the home of Fujiwara no Moromichi. ==Related pages== * Heian period ==References== ==Other websites== * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Jōtoku 1st 2nd 3rd Gregorian 1097 1098 1099 Preceded by: Eichō Era or nengō: Jōtoku Succeeded by: Kōwa Category:Japanese eras
title: Jōtoku
